definition: to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

sentences.english: The main reason for the slowly speed reading is the habit of reading silently many years.
sentences.chinese: 制约学生阅读速度的主要原因是多年养成的默读习惯。

sentences.english: Put your finger on your lips as you read silently .
sentences.chinese: 当你默读时，把你的指头放在你的嘴唇上。

sentences.english: Subvocalization is often considered the biggest barrier to speed reading.
sentences.chinese: 默读被视为速读的最大障碍。

sentences.english: The whole thing is meant to be seen in your mind, not just read silently.
sentences.chinese: 这一切都要你在脑海中想象，而不只是默读。

sentences.english: When humans first began reading written words, it was unusual to read in silence.
sentences.chinese: 当人类第一次阅读书面文字时，默读是不常见的。

sentences.english: A result of "lazy reading" of words read silently.
sentences.chinese: 这是对懒人式的默读的测试结果。

sentences.english: Of course, there are times when subvocalization is a good idea — as in the case of dense texts or subjects with which you’re not familiar.
sentences.chinese: 当然，有些时候，默读是一种好的方法。

sentences.english: This will enable you to break the habit of subvocalization.
sentences.chinese: 这将使你能够克服掉默读习惯。

sentences.english: Don't read to yourself. Please read aloud.
sentences.chinese: 不要默读，请读出声音来。

definition: (of a pupil) to write down (in a dictation exercise)/dictation/(music) to transcribe by ear
literal/word by word and phrase by phrase
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
to write on the blackboard/writing on the blackboard
new character (in textbook)/character that is unfamiliar or not yet studied
to pause at appropriate points in reading aloud unpunctuated writing/to punctuate
